hypothesis_content.title: BTC Post-Weekend Gap Fade in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: In a NEUTRAL regime, when Bitcoin opens the Monday 00:00 UTC weekly candle with a price gap >2.5% from the prior Sunday 23:59 UTC price, a fade of that gap (short if gap up, long if gap down) will be profitable within the first 12 trading hours of the week.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Weekend liquidity is thin, often driven by retail sentiment and isolated news. In neutral regimes without strong trending momentum, institutional flows at week open tend to correct illiquid weekend moves. The 2.5% threshold filters for significant, tradeable gaps.
entry_conditions: Monday 00:00 UTC BTC price vs. Sunday 23:59 UTC price shows |gap| > 2.5%
Enter limit order at 50% retracement of the gap at time of detection
Trade direction: SHORT if gap up, LONG if gap down

exit_conditions.take_profit: Gap is fully closed (price returns to Sunday 23:59 UTC level)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price moves 1.5x the initial gap size in the adverse direction
exit_conditions.time_exit: 12 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Mean PnL of strategy is negative after 100 observed instances; or win rate < 45% with average loss > average win.
